Name: myeloid and lymphoid neoplasms with eosinophilia and abnormalities of PDGFRA
Definition: A myeloid neoplasm that is characterized by the formation of abnormal fusion genes that encode constitutively activated tyrosine kinases.
Synonym: Myeloid and Lymphoid Neoplasms with Eosinophilia and Rearrangement of PDGFRA

Name: myeloproliferative neoplasm
Definition: A myeloid neoplasm that is characterized by a group of slow growing blood cancers in which large numbers of abnormal red blood cells

Name: obsolete malignant neoplasm of lymphatic and hemopoietic tissue
Definition: A myeloid neoplasm that is characterized by a group of slow growing blood cancers in which large numbers of abnormal red blood cells

Name: myelofibrosis
Definition: A myeloid neoplasm that is located in the bone marrow which results in bone marrow being replaced by fibrous (scar) tissue.

Name: myelodysplastic myeloproliferative neoplasm
Definition: A myeloid neoplasm that results_in the overproduction of white blood cells.
